jobs.title: Senior Associate, Vertical AI
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Primary

Primary is a seed-stage venture capital firm dedicated to delivering exceptional support to the founders of transformational businesses. By pairing meaningful investment resources with the largest portfolio impact team of any seed investor, our portfolio companies have reached an industry-best seed-to-A graduation rate.

About the Role

We are looking for a Senior Associate to work in lockstep with General Partner, Jason Shuman. You’ll support Jason in finding, conducting diligence on, and winning great Vertical AI businesses. You’ll also spend your time supporting Jason’s efforts to incubate new businesses through our venture studio, Primary Labs. Here is a note from Jason about the opportunity:

We’re at a unique point in time where massive swathes of the economy – across traditional software and services – are set to be fundamentally transformed by AI, and I’m looking for my right hand to invest in and create this next generation of category defining businesses from day 0. You should be obsessed with the craft of venture capital and excited about methodically picking apart verticals, functions, and current software landscapes that are set to be reimagined from the ground up in an AI-native way.

I want someone who recognizes that VC is a services business where we will go above and beyond to try and create an edge for exceptional founders. You should be willing to challenge the status quo, be able to look at analysis from multiple perspectives, and should have a deep desire to push the boundaries of what seed stage investing means. I’m looking for an investor who is insatiably curious, an independent thinker, someone obsessed with tech, stories of business building, and human psychology. I’ve backed companies including Dandy, Latch, January AI, Standard Bots and more. I’ve also launched businesses with the former CEO of Angi’s List, 4 of the top 10 multi-family developers in the country, and signed a number of enterprise deals pre-product. If you’re excited to operate at the frontier of what’s possible in Vertical AI, and want to be part of a high-velocity, hyper-competitive team with deep conviction, this is the place to do it.

What You'll Do

  • Deal Sourcing: Conduct market research and actively seek out promising investment opportunities startups through various channels. Represent the firm to conduct an initial screen of prospects

  • Due Diligence: Perform thorough due diligence on potential investments including financial analysis, market assessment, competitive landscape evaluation, and team assessment. Independently run diligence processes with assistance from the Partner, effectively prioritizing diligence areas, synthesizing diligence work

  • Financial Analysis: Own relevant analyses for potential opportunities including financial, market sizing, unit economics, and cap table modeling.

  • Portfolio Support: Provide ongoing support to existing portfolio companies by coordinating with the portfolio impact team

  • Incubations: Ride shotgun with Jason on his work with Primary Labs to incubate new businesses and provide ad-hoc support where needed.

  • Market Insights: Stay on top of industry trends, news, and regulatory developments. Surface regular market insights and lead research on thematic deep dives on new potential investment areas.

  • Network Expansion: Cultivate and maintain relationships with key stakeholders in the vertical AI community, including founders, industry experts, talented operators, and other investors

  • Thought Leadership: Represent the firm at industry events, conferences, and panels. Support and execute on strategic brand building and thought leadership initiatives.

  • Firm Building: Support Partners with ongoing LP reporting and other firm building initiatives

About you

  • Must be available to work full-time in NYC

  • 4-7 years of relevant experience in venture capital or related investing roles with a demonstrated interest in Vertical AI and early stage investing

  • Entrepreneurial Spirit: You have an entrepreneur’s intrinsic motivation and are capable of independently running with business ideas with substantial ambiguity. You are resourceful, passionate about ownership and willing to hustle to win deals

  • Deeply curious: You have a strong desire to become an expert in a certain industry or business model and are willing to put in the work to do so

  • Analytical-thinker: You have a strong grasp of what makes a good business. You’re comfortable with financial statements & models and concepts and can quickly assess the feasibility and scalability of a new venture idea

  • Relationship-builder: You’re comfortable developing relationships with industry leaders from the ground up and have a deep knowledge of technology investing as well as a strong understanding of the VC ecosystem

  • Fast-learner: You’re able to learn rapidly, develop a strong point of view, and communicate compelling narratives

  • Strong communicator: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex ideas in a clear and concise manner

Compensation is market-competitive with a yearly cash base of $150,000-$200,000 and will include upside in our funds.

jobs.title: Operator-In-Residence (OIR): Cyber
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Company

Primary is a seed-stage venture capital firm dedicated to delivering exceptional support to the founders of transformational businesses. By pairing meaningful investment resources with the largest portfolio impact team of any seed investor, our portfolio companies have reached an industry-best seed-to-A graduation rate. The firm’s Incubation arm, Primary Labs, launched in 2019 to support the ideation, research and launch of new startups. Primary’s first three incubated companies will return its first fund many times over, and Primary is now primed for substantial growth in its Incubation efforts. Check out our blog post, “What Invention and Incubation have in Common” to learn more about Primary’s incubation philosophy.

About the Role

We at Primary have a concerted focus to invest in and incubate businesses in the cybersecurity market. We are looking to hire someone solely focused on helping us incubate multiple businesses in this domain over a 18-24 month period.

The right person for this role has experience in cybersecurity, either in a direct operating or consulting capacity, and is eager to apply that expertise in a venture-building context. They’re excited to build from 0 to 1, research and test new business concepts in this domain, and gain exposure to the VC process—diligencing, vetting, and refining ideas alongside experienced investors. More than anything, they believe there are still opportunities in the cybersecurity ecosystem to create multi-billion-dollar businesses, particularly as a new tech shift in AI reshapes the industry.

What You'll Do

  • Support Primary’s idea generation and vetting process

  • Conduct intensive market analysis, competitive landscaping and customer research

  • Develop business models, product roadmaps, and go-to-market strategies for the most promising startup ideas

  • Create pitch decks and other investor materials

  • Assist in recruiting the founding team (CEO & CTO) into the newly incubated business

About You

  • Self-starter: you have an entrepreneur’s intrinsic motivation, capable of independently running with business ideas with substantial ambiguity

  • Network-builder: you’re comfortable developing relationships with industry leaders from the ground up; having your own personal network in the cybersecurity space is a plus

  • Entrepreneurial: you are eager to engage in the venture and startup ecosystem and have your finger on the pulse when it comes to new deals and emerging business models in the cybersecurity landscape

  • Storyteller: you’re able to learn rapidly, develop a strong point of view, and communicate compelling narratives

  • Commercially-minded: you are comfortable with financial models and concepts and can quickly assess the feasibility and scalability of a new venture idea

  • 5+ years of experience in consulting or startups with a cybersecurity focus (ideally in offensive security / cyber for frontier tech)

jobs.title: Operator-In-Residence (OIR): Vertical AI
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Company

Primary is a seed-stage venture capital firm dedicated to delivering exceptional support to the founders of transformational businesses. By pairing meaningful investment resources with the largest portfolio impact team of any seed investor, our portfolio companies have reached an industry-best seed-to-A graduation rate. The firm’s Incubation arm, Primary Labs, launched in 2019 to support the ideation, research and launch of new startups. Primary’s first three incubated companies will return its first fund many times over, and Primary is now primed for substantial growth in its Incubation efforts. Check out our blog post, “What Invention and Incubation have in Common” to learn more about Primary’s incubation philosophy.

About the Role

Primary Labs is looking for an Operator-In-Residence (OIR) to join its Incubation program with a focus on vertical AI.

At Primary, we’re doubling down on vertical AI - building and backing companies that solve specific, high-value problems in narrowly defined markets. Our approach is hands-on and customer-driven: we have unfair access to partner deeply with end users, identify unmet needs, and rapidly test solutions at the intersection of software, workflow, and generative AI.

We're looking for a product-obsessed hacker to help us build one — or several — vertical AI companies from scratch.

You should be a cracked builder with a few years of engineering or product experience and a deep grip on the modern AI stack. You're curious, fast, and fearless — ready to dive into obscure industries, hunt down customer conversations, talk to users no one else is talking to, and ship experiments before most teams finish their kickoff decks. You learn by doing: building AI prototypes, spinning up landing pages, cold-emailing customers, reverse-engineering industry workflows, running outbound — whatever it takes to uncover real signal.

Most importantly, you believe that the current AI-driven technological shift presents a unique opportunity to build multi-billion-dollar businesses.

What You'll Do

  • Collaborate with the Primary Labs team to source, vet, and pressure-test startup ideas across vertical AI sectors

  • Conduct deep customer discovery, market analysis, and competitive landscaping to identify high-conviction problems

  • Build MVPs and prototypes to validate key assumptions and iterate quickly toward a solution

  • Develop go-to-market strategies, run early experiments (including outbound and growth hacks), and support customer onboarding

  • Create pitch decks and other investor materials

  • Join the company in its launch phase as a founding team member responsible for gaining initial traction, building out the rest of the team, and supporting business operations or go back to the drawing board with the Incubation program all over again

About You

  • Product Obsessed: You have 2–4 years of experience as an engineer, technical product manager, or founder; you’re comfortable getting hands-on with tools and prototypes

  • AI-savvy: You’re familiar with the generative AI ecosystem (LLMs, agents, embeddings, RAG, etc.) and excited about applying these technologies in specific industries

  • Self-starter: you have an entrepreneur’s intrinsic motivation, capable of independently running with business ideas with substantial ambiguity

  • Customer-obsessed: You love talking to users, asking the second question, and building products that solve real pain

  • Entrepreneurial: You thrive in ambiguity and enjoy wearing multiple hats. You spend your weekend playing with the latest AI tools, building side projects and studying businesses

  • Storyteller: you’re able to learn rapidly, develop a strong point of view, and communicate compelling narratives

  • Commercially-minded: you are comfortable with financial models and concepts and can quickly assess the feasibility and scalability of a new venture idea

jobs.title: Operator-In-Residence (OIR): AI Infrastructure (Software)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Company

Primary is a seed-stage venture capital firm dedicated to delivering exceptional support to the founders of transformational businesses. By pairing meaningful investment resources with the largest portfolio impact team of any seed investor, our portfolio companies have reached an industry-best seed-to-A graduation rate. The firm’s Incubation arm, Primary Labs, launched in 2019 to support the ideation, research and launch of new startups. Primary’s first three incubated companies will return its first fund many times over, and Primary is now primed for substantial growth in its Incubation efforts. Check out our blog post, “AI Accelerates Incubation Velocity” to learn more about Primary’s incubation philosophy.

About the Role

Primary Labs is looking for an Operator-In-Residence (OIR) to join Primary Labs with a focus on software opportunities within AI Infrastructure. This role is open to candidates based in the SF bay area who are willing to work in person in San Mateo 3+ days a week.

We’re amidst the biggest infrastructure build out in decades. Over $1T+ of capital will be deployed into AI infrastructure over the next decade, driven by explosive growth in compute demand. We believe the next wave of opportunity lies in the software layer to enable more AI innovation, performance, and efficiency – from new approaches in cognitive architecture and knowledge representation to developer tooling, model deployment, observability, cost management, and data infrastructure. As AI systems scale in speed & complexity, new software abstractions will be required to make them reliable, efficient and accessible.

The right person for this OIR role is a curious, adaptable software generalist who thrives at the intersection of business and technology. They’re strong on ideation, research, and execution — a doer who can both build and think strategically. Ideally, they bring experience across multiple AI software domains such as agent architecture, reasoning, benchmarking, reinforcement learning, world modeling, knowledge representation (knowledge graphs), AI kernel development (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Modular), or AI data engineering and MLOps. Above all, they must believe that there is a unique opportunity to build a multi-billion-dollar software business in the AI Infrastructure space.

What You'll Do

  • Support Primary’s idea generation and vetting process

  • Connect with academics and researchers and top institutions and learn about their work in order to explore opportunities for commercialization

  • Conduct intensive market analysis, competitive landscaping and customer research

  • Develop business models, product roadmaps, and go-to-market strategies for the most promising startup ideas

  • Create pitch decks and other investor materials

  • Join the company in its launch phase as a founding team member responsible for gaining initial traction, building out the rest of the team, and supporting business operations or go back to the drawing board with the Incubation program all over again

  • Support Primary’s executive recruiters in identifying and closing your Co-Founders

About You

  • Self-starter: you have an entrepreneur’s intrinsic motivation, capable of independently running with business ideas with substantial ambiguity

  • Network-builder: you’re comfortable developing relationships with industry leaders from the ground up

  • Entrepreneurial: you are eager to engage in the venture and startup ecosystem and have your finger on the pulse when it comes to new deals and emerging business models in the AI Infrastructure landscape

  • Storyteller: you’re able to learn rapidly, develop a strong point of view, and communicate compelling narratives

  • Commercially-minded: you are comfortable with financial models and concepts and can quickly assess the feasibility and scalability of a new venture idea

  • Technical acumen: software generalist, ideally not wed to just one technology or market, with experience in AI software across agent architecture, reasoning, knowledge representation, etc.

  • 4+ years of experience in the AI Infrastructure space as a Product Manager or Engineer with strong business sense
